response:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(input, "|");
while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
String token = st.nextToken();
if (token.equals("Record")) {
String[] fields = token.split("\\|");
for (int i = 0; i < fields.length; i++) {
System.out.println("Field " + (i + 1) + ": " + fields[i]);
}
}
}
}

<<<explanation>>>: This code uses the StringTokenizer class to split the input string by the "|" delimiter and store each token in the variable "token". It then checks if the token is "Record" and if so, it splits the token by the "|" delimiter again and stores the fields in an array. Finally, it prints out the fields one by one. This way, you can display the operating system information in your JSP page.
